Angie responded:

 I couldn't verify the id on both images. It seems likely, but according to some of the published resources there are other possibilities, especially the interior view. 

We'll add your input to our database for future researchers. 
Thanks!
Deb Wythe

We still can't come up with a definitive answer to this one, so we'll leave it an open question, whether it's the Ottoman of Persian Pavillion.

comment.author: 71362901@N07
comment._content:
For sure, this is in the Russian pavillion of Trocadero, in "l'Asie russe" aera (Asian Russia), where was shown the collections of Emir Bokarra.
L'Exposition de Paris (1900). Librairie Illustrée Montgredien et Cie Editeurs, Tome III

comment.author: 54481141@N06
comment._content: It is actually the Persian Pavilion, Dr Sheila Blair referred to it in her paper on medieval mihrabs from Iran she presented @CAA 2013 www.sedefscorner.com/2013/03/historians-of-islamic-art-as...
